name: Symbol Grounding (Emergent Language)
description: The ability of the swarm to spontaneously evolve a shared communication system (Language) to refer to environmental features, without central coordination.
findings: Implemented a Naming Game simulation with 50 agents and 3 objects.
Starting from a blank slate (no vocabulary), agents invented and propagated words.
The system converged to a state of 100% Communicative Success and 1 Unique Word per object.
This confirms that 'Meaning' can emerge from distributed consensus dynamics.
implications: Swarms can develop their own internal protocols.
Language is a complex adaptive system.
Consensus is a form of symmetry breaking.
